verses.text: 所以，我們應當離開基督初步的道理，努力進到成熟的地步，不必在懊悔致死的行為，信靠 神，洗禮，按手禮，死人復活，和永遠審判的教訓上再立根基。

words.note: Can also be a verb.
Often paired with 'sin' (罪) in biblical contexts.
A core concept in Christian faith.
Lit. 'washing rite'.
Lit. 'pressing hands rite'.
Can also be a verb 'to resurrect'.
Can also be an adjective.
Functions as a postposition.

verses.text: 只要 神允許，我們就這樣作。
因為那些曾經蒙了光照，嘗過屬天的恩賜的滋味，與聖靈有分，

words.note: Often implies receiving grace or favor.
Can also be a verb 'to enlighten'.
Lit. 'bestowed grace'.
Lit. 'holy spirit'.
`有份` is also a common word for 'have a share'.

verses.text: 並且嘗過 神美善的道和來世的權能的人，

words.note: Often used to describe God's nature.
In biblical context, often refers to 'the Word of God'.
Often implies divine or inherent power.

verses.text: 如果偏離了正道，就不可能再使他們重新悔改了。因為他們親自把 神的兒子再釘在十字架上，公然羞辱他。

words.note: A core concept in Christian theology.
Verb-complement structure indicating action and location.
Lit. 'cross-shaped frame'.
Postposition indicating location.

verses.text: 這就像一塊地，吸收了常常下在它上面的雨水，如果長出對種植的人有用的菜蔬，就從 神那裡得福。

words.note: Reverential space often precedes 神 in biblical texts.

verses.text: 但如果這塊地長出荊棘和蒺藜來，就被廢棄，近於咒詛，結局就是焚燒。

words.note: Common biblical imagery for sin/curse.
Common biblical imagery for sin/curse.
Often follows a verb to indicate direction or result.
More formal or literary than 近乎.
Often refers to divine judgment by fire in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 不過，親愛的弟兄們，我們雖然這樣說，但對於你們，我們卻深信你們有更好的表現，結局就是得救。

words.note: Used in the Bible to address fellow believers.
Indicates a contrast or turning point.
A core concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 因為 神並不是不公義，以致忘記了你們的工作，和你們為他的名所表現的愛心，就是你們以前服事聖徒，現在還是服事他們。

words.note: Reverential space often precedes 神 in biblical texts.
Emphatically negates '是'.
A key attribute of God in the Bible.

words.definition: with the result that, so that

words.note: Refers to God.
Often represents reputation or authority in biblical context.
Forms a noun phrase with the following verb.
Often refers to spiritual love or charity.
Often implies spiritual service or ministry.
Refers to believers in Christ.
Often implies spiritual service or ministry.

verses.text: 我們深願你們各人都表現同樣的熱誠，一直到底，使你們的盼望可以完全實現，

words.note: In biblical context, often implies spiritual zeal.
Implies perseverance.
Often refers to spiritual hope for the future.

verses.text: 並且不要懶惰，卻要效法那些憑著信心和忍耐承受應許的人。

words.note: Often used in a moral or religious context.
Refers to religious faith in this context.
To take on or bear something, often implying inheritance or responsibility.
Often refers to God's promises in a biblical context.

verses.text: 神起誓保證他的應許 神應許亞伯拉罕的時候，因為沒有比自己更大的可以指著起誓，他就指著自己起誓，

words.definition: there is not, to not have

verses.text: 說：「我必定賜福給你，必定使你的後裔繁多。」

words.note: Specifically refers to divine blessing.
More formal or literary than '子孫' (zǐsūn).
Formal term for being abundant.

verses.text: 這樣，亞伯拉罕耐心等待，終於獲得了所應許的。

words.note: Grammatical particle forming a nominalized clause, like 'that which was promised'.

verses.text: 因為人起誓都是指著比自己大的起誓。這誓言就了結了他們中間的一切糾紛，作為保證。
照樣， 神定意向那些承受應許的人，更清楚地表明他的旨意是不更改的，就用起誓作保證。

words.note: Refers to the monotheistic God
Often used for God's promises in scripture
Often refers to divine will

words.definition: to serve as, to act as

verses.text: 這兩件事是不能更改的，因為 神是決不說謊的。因此，我們這些逃進避難所的人，就大得安慰，抓緊那擺在我們面前的盼望。

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'speak lies'
Lit. 'place to avoid disaster'

verses.text: 我們有這盼望，就像靈魂的錨，又穩當又堅固，通過幔子直進到裡面。

words.note: Used in parallel structure '又...又...'
Refers to the temple curtain

verses.text: 耶穌已經為我們作先鋒進入了幔子裡面；他是照著麥基洗德的體系，成了永遠的大祭司。

words.definition: to serve as, to act as

words.note: Lit. 'first vanguard'
